caption.p: Routes of NiV transmission. Different locations have different routes of transmission. ( A) In Malaysia, bat bitten fruits contaminated with NiV-M were consumed by pigs and workers handling the pigs were infected with NiV-M. ( B) In Bangladesh, bat saliva- and excreta-contaminated palm sap consumption lead to NiV-B infection in humans and was spread further via nosocomial mode. Infected bats shed the virus in their urine, excreta and saliva. ( C) In India, the possibility of direct bat-to-human transmission has been reported in Kerala state, but this was not supported by adequate evidence.
